|rad2oui = |rad2_ant_conn = U.FL |rad2txchains = 4 |rad2rxchains = 4 |rad2sstreams = 4 |rad2stand = IEEE 802.11a/n/ac/ax |rad2ax = |acqam2 = |rad2ac = 1733 |rad2n = 600 |rad2a = 54 |rad2freq = 5 }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== "RT5000W-D187(RoHS) Rev:2.1" is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos. :This device may also go by the model name of RT5000 (OEM: [[Askey]]). This device will likely be rented by Spectrum (Charter) to their cable :internet customers who pay for Wi-Fi. ==Links of Interest== ===News=== *[https://www.fiercewireless.com/tech/charter-s-cowden-outlines-mso-s-mvno-launch-plans-and-dates-vepc-work-and-cbrs-3-5-ghz-trials ''Charter’s Cowden outlines MSO’s MVNO launch plans and dates,
vEPC work and CBRS 3.5 GHz trials'' on '''FierceWireless'''] (9/14/2017) :“We want to make sure most of that traffic goes over Wi-Fi and not the MVNO,” :Cowden added. “Wi-Fi is an important part of what we do and will continue to be.” :Interestingly, he said Charter is working to deploy 802.11 ac Wave 2 Wi-Fi :technology today, and next year will move to 802.11 ax Wi-Fi technology. ===Forum threads=== *[https://www.snbforums.com/threads/charter-rax1v1k-4x4-802-11ax-wireless-router-w-qualcomm-ipq8072-qcn5024-qcn5054.47396/ ''Charter RAX1V1K - 4x4 802.11ax Wireless Router'' on '''SNB''' forums] ==Pictures==
'''FCCID {{fccid|fccidnumber}}''' Image:H8NRAX1V1K FCC Mainboard.jpg|board top
[[Has images::internal| ]][[Has images::fcc| ]] ==See also== :[[List of 802.11ax Hardware]] *'''Charter RAX1V1K''' - [[Askey RT5000W]] - 802.11ax DBDC Router *[[Arris RAC2V1A]] - [[Arris TR4400-AC]] ([[SerComm]]) *[[Askey RAC2V1K]] - [[Askey RT4230W]] ([[Askey]]) *[[Sagemcom RAC2V1S]] - [[Sagemcom F@ST 5280]] *[[Askey RT4220W]] • ''Cube Router'' - 802.11ac 2x2 Router • [http://www.askey.com.tw/wireless10.html PPage] *[[Askey RT4230W]] • ''Puma Router'' - 802.11ac 4x4 Router • [http://www.askey.com.tw/wireless_RT4230W.html PPage] [[Category:English Documentation]]
